common_issues.title: Ollama Installation and Model Download Failures
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Ollama installation and model downloads in the Pieces desktop app across Linux and Windows.  This is due to missing dependencies, sandbox restrictions, and general download failures.  Proposed solutions include dependency updates, sandbox configuration changes, and improved download error handling.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Problem downloading and installing OLLAMA due to missing `curl` dependency in Pieces-OS snap.
* Sandboxed environment of snap prevents Pieces-OS from accessing executables outside its scope.
* Long waiting time for a fix, causing inconvenience and delay in using Pieces-OS.
* User concerns about privacy and security regarding cloud-based LLMs.

**Identified Problems:**

* OLLAMA installation failure due to missing `curl` dependency.
* Strict confinement of Pieces-OS snap, limiting access to external tools like `curl` and OLLAMA.
* Lack of a readily available solution or workaround.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Adding `curl` to the dependency list in the Pieces-OS snap definition file.
* Developing a patch to allow OLLAMA usage within the sandbox environment.
* Infrastructure updates have been completed, and the fix is prioritized for the next update.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Patch is currently in development and will be included in the next Pieces-OS update.
* Temporary workaround for downloading local LLM models is not available due to existing limitations.
* Users are encouraged to wait for the upcoming update.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users are concerned about privacy and security related to cloud-based LLMs.
* The issue has been acknowledged and prioritized for a fix.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (@johnkennyuk) reported issues with the account linking process, finding it unclear and difficult to use.
* The user provided additional details about their specific situation involving two accounts.

**Problems identified:**

* The current account linking flow is not user-friendly and requires improvement.
* The user experienced difficulties linking their two accounts.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team acknowledged the problem and confirmed that they are working on a replacement for the current account linking flow.
* The team offered a temporary solution for the user to meet with a support representative (mark-at-pieces) to solve the issue with their specific accounts.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The new account linking flow is scheduled to be implemented mid to late February 2025.
* The user can connect with mark-at-pieces to resolve their specific account linking issue in the meantime.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation took place on February 4, 2025.
* The user was directed to helpful resources including existing issues, documentation, and the Pieces YouTube channel.

recommendations: **Prioritize Ollama Installation and Model Download Issues:** The most frequent and active support tickets revolve around Ollama installation and model download failures. Focus on resolving the underlying causes, such as dependency conflicts, sandbox restrictions, and download errors.

**Improve Account Linking in Pieces Desktop App:** Address the persistent issue of account linking problems in the Pieces Desktop app. The planned replacement for the account linking flow should be prioritized and thoroughly tested to ensure a seamless user experience.

**Enhance Communication and Transparency:** Keep users informed about the status of known issues, planned fixes, and workarounds. Proactive communication can help manage user expectations and reduce support ticket volume.

**Review and Update Documentation:** Ensure that support documentation, including troubleshooting guides and FAQs, is up-to-date and addresses the common issues reported by users. Clear and comprehensive documentation can empower users to resolve problems independently.

**Investigate Pieces Copilot Service Issues:** Look into the reports of users unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service. Identify the root cause of the error and provide a solution or workaround to affected users.

**Gather More Detailed User Feedback:** Implement mechanisms to collect more detailed feedback from users, such as through in-app surveys or feedback forms. Understanding user pain points and areas for improvement can guide future development and support efforts.
